1.text: Get a garlic bulb and separate a clove.

2.text: Cut away the brown top of the garlic.

3.text: Place the clove on a chopping board.

4.text: Place the flat side of the knife on the clove and push down firmly.

5.text: Peel away the skin and waste with your hands.

6.text: Use the peeled clove, either chopped or full.

7.text: Remove as many cloves as you need from the head.

8.text: Soak the cloves in cold water for five minutes, making sure they are fully submerged.

10.text: Remove the cloves you need from the head.

11.text: Put the garlic clove/s in the microwave for 5-10 seconds.

12.text: Cut away the loose remaining skin.

13.text: Place the entire garlic head inside one stainless steel bowl.

14.text: Cover the bowl with another identical stainless steel bowl.

15.text: Hold the edges of the two bowls together and shake.

16.text: Open the bowls and remove any waste.

17.text: Keep shaking until all of the skins are removed.

19.text: Place the cloves evenly under a dry cloth.

20.text: Pound the garlic cloves once or twice with a mallet.

21.text: Remove the cloves from the cracked outer shell.
